text:
(1) The Queensborough Bridge: A view eastward of same from Second Ave., at East 59th Street (right), showing the Manhattan Approach.

May 6, 1910.

W. L. Bogert.
(Not a dry mount item).

(2) The same from a different angle and giving a more extensive view of Queensborough Bridge.

About 1920.

No Record.
title: Bridges - Queensboro [Queensborough] Bridge - [Manhattan approach at 2nd Avenue and East 59th Street.]

text:
Queensboro Bridge: The approach from Second Avenue and E. 59th Street in Manhattan. The photographer is viewing southeastward towards the East River from the above location.

About 1912

Gift of Urbrock Collection
title: Bridges - Queensboro [Queensborough] Bridge - [Manhattan approach at 2nd Avenue and East 59th Street.]

text:
E. 59th Street, east of Second Avenue, showing the Queensboro Bridge approach on the north side of this thoroughfare.

About 1915

Gift of Urbrock Collection

Route: Queensboro Bridge Connection (v66) Sec. 43 No. 3
Location: 59th St & 2nd Av.
Subject: Construction Photograph
Description: Approach to Queensboro Bridge from 2nd Av. Elevated at 59th St.

June 26,1917

text:

title: Bridges - Queensboro [Queensborough] Bridge -[Construction of the bridge connection.]

text:
59th Street, east from but not including Second Avenue. March 22, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

221-233 East 59th Street, north side, between Second and Third Avenues. St. Thomas House is in the centre.
May 4, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Queensboro Bridge, from atop Radio City Tower. The bridge starts at 59th Street and Second Ave., in Manhattan, over Welfare Island; to Bridge Plaza in Long Island City.

August 9, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same.

August 9, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

title: Bridges - Queensboro [Queensborough] Bridge - [View of the bridge from Radio City Tower.]

text:
59th Street, north side, east of Second Avenue. July 2, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

210-230 East 59th Street, south side, east from, but not including Third, to, but not including Second Aves. Shown at No. 222, (2-story building), is the North Eastern Dispensary.

June 11, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Second Avenue and 59th Street, east El train at Queensborough Bridge.

(2) Second Avenue east side north from 58th Street, showing elevated and a motor bus.

(3) Second Avenue northeast corner 60th Street, showing El demolition.

P.L.Speer.

April 7, 1941.
